thread.title: Stonington girls win first ECC cross country championship
thread.title_full: Stonington girls win first ECC cross country championship

author: Gavin Keefe
title: Stonington girls win first ECC cross country championship
text:
Already registered on theday.com? Login. 
Not registered on theday.com? Register . Close Stonington girls win first ECC cross country championship East Lyme's Vann Moffett, center, is flanked by NFA's Connor Gralton, left, and Tyler Sholes as they lead the rest of the pack in the later stages of Thursday's Eastern Connecticut Conference boys' scross country championship at the Norwich Golf Course. Gralton won the individual title, Moffett finished second and Sholes third as NFA cruised to the team title. (Tim Cook/The Day) Published October 22. 2015 5:41PM By Gavin Keefe 
Norwich â€” The Stonington girls' cross country team pulled off a stunning victory Thursday afternoon in the Eastern Connecticut Conference Championship meet at the Norwich Golf Course. 
The Bears won their first ECC title, easily outdistancing the field with 80 points. Bacon Academy took second with 112 and pre-race favorite Norwich Free Academy was third with 120. Freshman Caroline Morehouse led Stonington with a fourth-place finish. 
Plainfield's Brooke Brouillard was the individual winner, crossing the finish line in 20 minutes, 13 seconds. Ledyard's Megan Brawner placed second in 20:34. 
In the boys' race, NFA won the team title by placing five runners in the top 10. The Wildcats had 23 points and second-place Ledyard had 67. 
NFA's Connor Gralton won his second individual ECC title, posting a time of 16:52. East Lyme's Vann Moffett was second in 17:01. 

Stonington's Caroline Morehouse comes in for a fourth-place finish in Thursday's Eastern Connecticut Conference girls' cross country championship at the Norwich Golf Course and leading the surprising Bears to the team championship. (Tim Cook/The Day)
